citation.article-title: Nocardiopsis compostus sp. nov., from the atmosphere of a composting facility
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Nocardiopsis compostus sp. nov.
Nocardiopsis compostus (com.pos'tus ; L. masc. adj. compostus originating from compost)
Aerobic, oxidase- and catalase-positive nocardioform actinomycete.
Usually, the aerial mycelium is white.
Substrate mycelium is colourless to brownish-yellow.
Long, branched substrate hyphae fragment into non-motile elements.
Melanin is not produced on CASO agar.
No growth occurs on either CASO or SGA agar containing NaCl concentrations of 15% or higher.
pH values of 6.5-9.5 are tolerated, but no growth occurs at pH 4.5.
No growth is observed at a temperature of 10 °C, but growth occurs up to 50 °C.
Compounds utilized/not utilized as sole carbon sources and compounds hydrolysed/not hydrolysed are listed in Table 2.

The polar lipid profile is characterized by the presence of the predominant compounds phosphatidylmonomethylethanolamine, phosphatidylcholine, diphosphatidylglycerol, phosphatidylglycerol and two unknown phospholipids (type PIII sensu Lechevalier et al., 1977).
The quinone system comprises MK-10(H8), MK-11(H8), MK- 10(H6) and MK-12 as major compounds and minor amounts of MK-13, MK-11(H6), MK-9(H8) and MK- 10(H4).
Major fatty acids are of the iso- and anteisobranched type, combined with tuberculostearic acid (Me18), straight-chain saturated (16:0, 18:0) and some unsaturated (16:1, 17: 1, 18:1) acids.
Type strain is strain KS9T (=DSM 44551T=NRRL B-24145T).
Isolated from the air surrounding a composting facility in Kassel, Germany.
